oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Laboratory Variation of Serum Immunoglobulin Analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Campbell, J. M.
Russell, L. E.
Weaver, E. M.
Crenshaw, J.D.
Grinstead, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: laboratory techniques
serum immunoglobulin analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Data indicate that laboratory variation exists. When interpreting serum IgG results, knowledge of the laboratory, techniques, and analytical variation should be considered. Consistency is essential to reduce variation. Thus, using the same laboratory and analytical techniques will reduce variation and minimize inaccurate diagnosis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2007; 283
